meanings.definition: In front of or ahead of in place or position.
meanings.sent1: The cat sat foreby the window, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent2: She placed her bag foreby the door before entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran foreby the tree, trying to impress the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The sun rose foreby the mountains, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The child stood foreby the giant statue, marveling at its size.

meanings.sent1: He prepared his speech foreby the event to ensure it was perfect.
meanings.sent2: She always finishes her homework foreby going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The students studied foreby the exam, hoping to get good grades.
meanings.sent4: The chef chopped the vegetables foreby starting to cook the meal.
meanings.sent5: The team practiced foreby the big game to improve their skills.

meanings.sent1: Foreby the cake, there were also cookies at the party.
meanings.sent2: She bought a dress foreby the shoes she already had.
meanings.sent3: Foreby the main course, there were many side dishes on the table.
meanings.sent4: The book had illustrations foreby the text to help understand the story.
meanings.sent5: Foreby the flowers, there were also balloons decorating the room.
